text: Mathew Anikuzhikattil (23 September 1942 - 1 May 2020) was a Syro-Malabar Catholic bishop. Anikuzhikatil was born in India and was ordained to the priesthood in 1971. He served as bishop of the Syro-Malabar Catholic Eparchy of Idukki, India, from 2003 to 2018.Syo-Malabar Epachy of Idukki ==Life== Anikuzhikattil was born in Kadaplamattom in Kottayam district, although he was raised in Kunchithanny in Idukki district. He was ordained as a priest on 15 March 1971 at his home parish of Holy Family church in Kunchithanny by Mathew Pothanamuzhi. On 15 January 2003 Pope John Paul II announced the creation of the Syro-Malabar Catholic Eparchy of Idukki with Anikuzhikattil as the first bishop. On 02 March 2003 Anikuzhikattil was consecrated a bishop and the eparchy was inaugurated by Cardinal Varkey Vithayathil C.Ss.R.. As priest and bishop he also served as the chairman of the KCBC commission for family, laity and women, and was also the patron of the High Range Samrakshana Samithi (HRSS), a people's movement within the Catholic Church in India. As normal, he retired in 2018 after reaching the age of 75. On 1 May 2020 Anikuzhikattil died of age-related problems at the Malankara Orthodox Syrian Church Medical College Hospital, Kolenchery at 1:38 A.M. ==Notes== Category:1942 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Syro-Malabar bishops Category:People from Kottayam district Category:People from Idukki district Category:20th-century Roman Catholic bishops Category:21st-century Roman Catholic bishops
